"""
Graphics module

initiation and configuration of figure objects etc

Created: Autumn 2016
Authors: Petter Lind & David Lindstedt

# Global modules
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Functions

[docs]def figure_setup(figsize=(12,12), plottype='lineplot', printtypes=False):
    '''
    Setting up a figure object

    Parameters
    ----------
    figsize: tuple
        Size of figure in inches; (width, height)
    plottype: string
        Type of plot to make
    printtypes: boolean
        If available plottypes should be printed on screen
    '''
    pltypes = {
            'map'     : 'classic',
            'line'    : 'ggplot',
            'scatter' : 'fivethirtyeight'
            }

    if printtypes:
        print("Available plot types: \n", pltypes.keys())
    else:
        plt.style.use(pltypes[plottype])
        fig = plt.figure(figsize=figsize)

        return fig



[docs]def grid_setup(fig, fshape, **grid_kwargs):
    '''
    Set up the plot axes using mpl_toolkits.ImageGrid

    Parameters
    ----------
        fig: Figure object
        fshape: tuple
            setting the shape of figure (nrow, ncol)
        **grid_kwargs: Additional keyword arguments

    Returns
    -------
        grid: AxesGrid object

    Examples of **kwargs with default values:
        direction="row",
        axes_pad=0.02,
        add_all=True,
        share_all=False,
        label_mode = "L",
        aspect=True,
        cbar_mode=None,
        cbar_location='right',
        cbar_size="5%",
        cbar_pad=None,
    '''

    from mpl_toolkits.axes_grid1 import ImageGrid

    grid = ImageGrid(fig,
                     111,
                     nrows_ncols=fshape,
                     **grid_kwargs
                     )
    return grid



[docs]def axes_settings(ax, figtitle, xlabel, ylabel, xtlabels=None, ytlabels=None,
        xticks=None, yticks=None, xlim=None, ylim=None):
    '''
    Configuration of axes; titles and labels

    Parameters
    ----------
        ax: axes object
            Axes object assoicated with figure
        figtitle: string
            The headtitle
        xlabel, ylabel: strings
            Labels of the axes
        xticks, yticks: lists or arrays
            If set, location of ticks
        xtlabels, ytlabels: lists or arrays
            Contains tick labels (corresponding to ticks location)
        xlim, ylim: lists or arrays
            Limits of the axes
    '''
    import py_colors

    black     = py_colors.getsinglecolor('almost_black')
    
    ax.set_title(figtitle, fontsize='x-large', color=black)

    ax.set_ylabel(ylabel, fontsize='x-large', color=black)
    ax.set_xlabel(xlabel, fontsize='x-large', color=black)
    
    ((xticks is not None) and ax.set_xticks(xticks))
    ((xtlabels is not None) and ax.set_xticklabels(xtlabels, color=black))
    ((yticks is not None) and ax.set_yticks(yticks))
    ((ytlabels is not None) and ax.set_yticklabels(ytlabels, color=black))

    ((xlim is not None) and ax.set_xlim(xlim))
    ((ylim is not None) and ax.set_ylim(ylim))

    [t.set_fontsize('x-large') for t in ax.get_xticklabels()]
    [t.set_fontsize('x-large') for t in ax.get_yticklabels()]




[docs]def map_axes_settings(fig, axs, figtitle, headtitle):
    '''
    Settings for map plot axes

    Parameters
    ----------
        fig: Object handle
            Figure handle
        axs: List
            List with axes from map plot
        figtitle: List 
            List of titles for each plot in figure
        headtitle: String
            Head title of figure
    '''

    [ax.set_title(figtitle[i], fontsize='x-large') for i, ax in enumerate(axs)]
    fig.suptitle(headtitle, fontsize='xx-large')




[docs]def make_legend(ax, labels, loc=0, fontsize='large', ncol=2, sc_points=1,
        num_points=1):
    '''
    Adds legend to plot

    Parameters
    ----------
        ax          -   Axes object of figure
        labels      -   String or list of strings; labels of legend items
        loc         -   Location of legend; default 0 ('best')
        fontsize    -   Fontsize of labels
        ncol        -   Number of columns for multiple legend items
        sc_points   -   Number of points in legend for scatterplot
        num_points  -   Number of points in legend for line plot

    Returns
    -------
        legend: legend object
    '''
    legend = ax.legend(
                        labels=labels,
                        loc=loc,
                        ncol=ncol,
                        scatterpoints=sc_points,
                        numpoints=num_points,
                        fontsize=fontsize
              )

    return legend




[docs]def make_scatter_plot(grid, xdata, ydata, labels, **sc_kwargs):
    """
    Create a scatter plot

    Parameters
    ----------
        grid: AxesGrid object 
            returned from the 'grid_setup' function
        xdata/ydata: List of array 
            with data for x/y axis
        labels: List
            List with strings of legend labels
        **sc_kwargs: keyword arguments
            arguments (key=value) that can be used in pyplot.scatter
            See matplotlib.org for more information

    Returns
    -------
        axs: Axes objects
            The axes objects created for each plot
    """

    axs = []    
    for g, ax in enumerate(grid):
        xd = xdata[g]
        yd = ydata[g]
        
        ax.scatter(xd, yd, label=labels[g], **sc_kwargs)
        axs.append(ax)

    return axs



[docs]def make_line_plot(grid, xdata, ydata, labels, **lp_kwargs):
    """
    Create a line plot

    Parameters
    ----------
        grid: AxesGrid object 
            returned from the 'grid_setup' function
        xdata/ydata: List of array 
            with data for x/y axis
        labels: List
            List with strings of legend labels
        **lp_kwargs: keyword arguments
            arguments (key=value) that can be used in pyplot.line 
            See matplotlib.org for more information

    Returns
    -------
        axs: Axes objects
            The axes objects created for each plot
    """
    axs = []    
    for g, ax in enumerate(grid):
        if len(xdata) == 1:
            xd = xdata[0]
        else:
            xd = xdata[g]
        yd = ydata[g]

        ax.plot(xd, yd, alpha=.7, label=labels[g], **lp_kwargs)
        axs.append(ax)
    
    return axs



[docs]def mapprod(grid, lat, lon, proj='stere', lon_0=None, lat_0=None, lat_ts=None,
        lat_1=None, lat_2=None, res='i', zoom='crnrs', zoom_geom=None, area_thrs=1000):
    """
    Create a basemap object to be used in the overlaying of 2d plots.

    Parameters
    ----------
    lat: array
        array of the latitudes
    lon: array
        array of the longitudes
    proj: string
        the projection to be used (so far only two proj's: 
        sterographic and lambert conformal)
    lat_0/lon_0: float
        centre latitude and longitude location of map
    lat_1: float
        first standard parallell. if proj='lcc', lat_1 must be given.
    lat_2: float
        second standard parallell (defaults to lat_1). if proj='lcc', lat_1 must be given.
    res: string
        resolution (low 'l', intermediate 'i' or high 'h')
    zoom: string
        "cornrs" or "geom", how to set the extent of map
    area_thrs: float
        threshold area (default 1000 km2), under which objects are not
        shown on map.

    Returns
    -------
    m: Basemap object
        map object
    coords: list
        list containing x,y arrays of the transformed longitudes to map coordinates
    """
    from mpl_toolkits.basemap import Basemap

    # Set default for lat_2 for lambert conformal proj
    if proj=='lcc' and not lat_2:
        lat_2 = lat_1

    if lon.max() > 180:
        lon[lon > 180] -= 360.
        lon.sort()

    if np.ndim(lat) == 2:
        # The central point of the domain
        ny, nx = lat.shape
        if lat_0:
            lat_0 = lat_0
        else:
            lat_0 = lat[np.int(ny/2), np.int(nx/2)]
        if lon_0:
            lon_0 = lon_0
        else:
            lon_0 = lon[np.int(ny/2), np.int(nx/2)]  

        corners = [lat[0,0], lon[0,0], lat[-1,-1], lon[-1,-1]]
    else:
        # The central point of the domain
        ny = lat.size
        nx = lon.size
        if lat_0:
            lat_0 = lat_0
        else:
            lat_0 = lat[np.int(ny/2)]
        if lon_0:
            lon_0 = lon_0
        else:
            lon_0 = lon[np.int(nx/2)]  
        
        corners = [lat[0], lon[0], lat[-1], lon[-1]]

        # Create lon/lat 2D meshgrid
        lon, lat = np.meshgrid(lon, lat) 
    
    m_arr = []
    if zoom == 'crnrs':
        for ax in grid:
            m = Basemap(projection=proj, ax=ax,
                    lat_0=lat_0, lon_0=lon_0, lat_ts=lat_ts, lat_1=lat_1, lat_2=lat_2,\
                    llcrnrlat=(corners[0]),urcrnrlat=(corners[2]),\
                    llcrnrlon=(corners[1]),urcrnrlon=(corners[3]),\
                    rsphere=(6378137.00,6356752.3142),area_thresh=area_thrs,resolution=res)
            m_arr.append(m)
    else:
        assert zoom_geom, '''Error! \n zoom_geom argument is empty; set 
        correctly, [width/height] in meters, and try again.'''

        for ax in grid:
            m = Basemap(projection=proj, 
                    lat_0=lat_0, lon_0=lon_0, lat_ts=lat_0, lat_1=lat_1, lat_2=lat_2,\
                    width=zoom_geom[0], height=zoom_geom[1],\
                    rsphere=(6378137.00,6356752.3142),area_thresh=area_thrs,resolution=res)
            m_arr.append(m)

    coords = [k(lon, lat) for k in m_arr]                # compute map proj coordinates.
    
    return m_arr, coords




[docs]def make_map_plot(grid, map_obj, data, coords, clevs=None, cmap='jet', norm=None):
    """
    make_map_plot: Producing a map plot
    
    Parameters
    ----------
    grid: AxesGrid object
        Provides the axes for plots
    map_obj: Basemap object
        Handle for the map object returned from 'mapprod' function
    data: List with 2D array(s)
        data to plot
    coords: List
        List with arrays of map coordinates; returned from 'mapprod' function
    clevs: 1D list/array 
        contour levels
    cmap: string
        color map name
    cb_title: string
        color bar title

    Returns
    -------
        axs: Axes object
            The axes objects created for each map plot
    """

    assert type(data).__name__== 'list', \
            """ Error! 2D data array(s) must be stored in 
            list data container. """

    x = [coords[i][0] for i in range(len(coords))]
    y = [coords[i][1] for i in range(len(coords))]
    
    axs = []

    for i,ax in enumerate(grid):
        mdata = data[i]       
        assert mdata.ndim == 2, \
                "Error! Data array(s) must be two-dimensional."
      
        if clevs is None:
            dmin = np.floor(np.nanmin(mdata))
            dmax = np.ceil(np.nanmax(mdata))
            dstep = np.round((dmax - dmin)/12)
            clevels = range(dmin, dmax, dstep)
        else:
            clevels = clevs

        m = map_obj[i] 
        xc = x[i]
        yc = y[i]
        # The contour plot
        cs = m.contourf(
                        xc, yc, 
                        mdata, 
                        levels=clevels, 
                        cmap=cmap,
                        norm=norm,
                        alpha=.8,
#                        extend='both',
                        )

        m.drawcountries(linewidth=.7,color="#424242")
        m.drawcoastlines(linewidth=1.0, color='#383838')    # draw coastlines, state and country boundaries, edge of map.
        
        cb = grid.cbar_axes[i].colorbar(cs, norm=norm, ticks=clevels[::2],
                boundaries=clevels)
        cb.ax.tick_params(labelsize='x-large')
    
        axs.append(ax)
    
    return axs
